subject: Re: Help with Junitreport
msgSnippet: The TEST-*.xml does get generated and unfortunately I don t have access to it till monday when I will be at work. Will probably post it then. Anyway, thanks
messageBody:
The TEST-*.xml does get generated and unfortunately I don't have
access to it till monday when I will be at work. Will probably post it
then.
Anyway, thanks
Shan
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...> wrote:
> shankris72 wrote:
>
> <junitreport todir="${testreports.dir}">
> <fileset dir="${testreports.dir}"
> includes="TEST-*.xml"/>
> <report todir="${testreports.dir}"
> format="frames"/>
> </junitreport>
>
> Look in the directory ${testreports.dir}. Are there really TEST-*.xml
> files in there?
> --
> J. B. Rainsberger,
> Diaspar Software Services
> http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
> Let's write software that people understand
